sub_title:
Head of Behaviour and Welfare, IVC Evidensia NL.
EBVS European Veterinary Specialist in Behavioural Medicine
summary:
I'm an EBVS® European Veterinary Specialist in Behavioural Medicine and a Diplomate of the European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine (in the sub-speciality Animal Welfare Science, Ethics and Law and also in the sub-speciality Behavioural Medicine). I'm interested in all aspects of behaviour and welfare in all animals but particularly managing pathological behaviour in companion animals and horses and the effects of different management systems on horses, laboratory, farm and zoo animals. Ethics, particularly the ethical use of animals and legislation are also key areas for me. 

My work primarily involves patient care, welfare assessments, teaching and research. I also function as an expert witness in cases where dogs have been seized.
My voluntary work activities involve bringing the sciences of behavioural medicine and animal welfare to vets and also to the greater public.

Titles / Accreditations: 
Dip. ECAWBM (BM): Diplomate of the European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine (Behavioral Medicine).
Dip. ECAWBM (AWSEL): Diplomate of the European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine (Animal Welfare Science, Ethics and Law).
Cert WEL (RCVS): Certificate in Animal Welfare Science, Ethics and Law (Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons): attained in 2010.
Master of Science (Laboratory Animal Science) from the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, University of Ghent in Belgium: attained in 2006.
MRCVS: Member of the Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons
MVB: Medicina Veterinaria Bacholereus (Degree in Veterinary Medicine)

treasury_media.title: Veterinaire gedragsgeneeskunde
treasury_media.description:
Gedragsgeneeskunde kijkt naar de fysieke gesteldheid en het mentale welzijn van een dier. Met beter begrip voor het dier ontstaat een behandelplan op maat.

Voor het behandelen van ernstige/extreme gedragsproblemen bij dieren; dierenwelzijn; deskundig advies over het houden van dieren, dieren wetgeving; interviews; educatie

https://www.edz-nieuwegein.nl/verwijskliniek/veterinaire-gedragsgeneeskunde

projects.title: Equine Behavioural Medicine: The how to for Veterinarians!
projects.description: Equine veterinarians involved in first opinion work tend to shy away from equine behaviour cases. This is a shame as the first line vet already has an armoury of tools necessary to tackle these type of problems. I've created a series of lectures aimed at equine veterinarians to help them unleash and fine tune these tools allowing them to  tackle equine behaviour cases and enjoy them! This results in a happy horse, a happy client and a happy vet!

company.name: Journal of Veterinary Behaviour Medicine: Clinical Applications and Research

profile_positions.company: Journal of Veterinary Behaviour Medicine: Clinical Applications and Research
profile_positions.description: Journal of Veterinary Behavior: Clinical Applications and Research is an international journal that focuses on all aspects of veterinary behavioral medicine, with a particular emphasis on clinical applications and research. Articles cover such topics as basic research involving normal signaling or social behaviors, welfare and/or housing issues, molecular or quantitative genetics, and applied behavioral issues (eg, working dogs, et cetera) that may have implications for clinical interest or assessment.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Editorial Board

profile_positions.description:
Patient care, teaching and research.

Diagnosing and treating pathological behaviour in animals, particularly dogs, cats and horses.
Education of veterinarians, veterinary technicians, veterinary students, animal behaviour therapists, animal trainers, members of the public.
Research in the areas of animal behaviour, veterinary behavioural medicine, veterinary medicine, animal welfare science, the ethics of animal use and animal protection legislation.
Providing welfare assessments/advice for interested parties including legislators, policy advisors.
Expert witness
Due to a multi-disciplinary approach, working together with other veterinary specialists it's possible to get to the root of problems and provide owners/care-takers with a welfare friendly treatment plan, grounded in scientific principles whilst respecting the animal itself.

Dogs & cats are treated at V.S.C. de Wagenrenk. Consultations are available on Tuesdays. Please click here for more information (in Dutch) http://www.wagenrenk.com/veterinaire-gedragskunde/

Horses & ponies are treated at the Universiteitskliniek voor Paarden, Faculteit Diergeneeskunde. 
Consultations are available in Dutch or in English.
Consultations are available on the first Monday of every month. Please click here for more information (in Dutch) http://www.diergeneeskunde.nl/klinieken/paarden/gedragspoli/
profile_positions.title: Veterinary Behaviour Specialist and Animal Welfare Consultant

company.name: Animal Welfare Science, Ethics and Law Veterinary Association

profile_positions.company: Animal Welfare Science, Ethics and Law Veterinary Association
profile_positions.description:
Founded in 1995, AWSELVA provides opportunities for all those with an interest in animal welfare to develop informed views and to learn more about animal welfare science, as well as relevant ethics and law.

www.awselva.org.uk
profile_positions.title: Committee Member

profile_positions.description: The Wagenrenk is a Veterinary Referral Clinic located in Wageningen in the Netherlands. I see companion animal (mainly dog and cat) behaviour cases there. Consults are available on Tuesdays (08:30 -17:00) and on Thursday mornings (10:00 - 13:00). Typical problems treated include pathological aggression and/or anxiety disorders, compulsive behaviours, house soiling problems, cognitive dysfunction (dementia) and animals that are highly reactive or otherwise uncontrollable. Veterinarians can refer patients to me or if they're unsure as to whether to refer or not they're welcome to phone to discuss www.wagenrenk.com Consultations are available in Dutch or in English.
profile_positions.title: Veterinary Behaviour Specialist

company.name: European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine

profile_positions.company: European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine
profile_positions.description:
The European College of Animal Welfare and Behavioural Medicine (ECAWBM) strives to provide animal owners and their veterinarians with veterinarians specialised in animal welfare and behavioural medicine through qualified European Specialists. The college is composed of two sub-specialities namely on animal welfare  and behavioural medicine. Diplomates have undergone an extensive, well-defined training over many years within the fields of animal welfare and behavioural medicine prior to becoming an ECAWBM Diplomate. This assures high quality service to the general pet owning public and to referring veterinarians.

As a double Diplomate, I'm proud to serve the ECAWBM in my capacity as Honorary Secretary.
profile_positions.title: Honoroary Secretary

company.name: Nederlandse Werkgroep Veterinaire Gedragskunde - Dutch Veterinary Behaviour Group

profile_positions.company: Nederlandse Werkgroep Veterinaire Gedragskunde - Dutch Veterinary Behaviour Group
profile_positions.description: De Nederlandse Werkgroep Veterinaire Gedragskunde (NWVG) is een actieve werkgroep en bestaat uit dierenartsen. Het doel van de werkgroep is dat de leden zich verdiepen in de kennis van normaal en pathologisch gedrag bij gezelschapsdieren en in het onderkennen, behandelen en voorkomen van gedragsproblemen bij dieren. De NWVG is de aanspreekpunt voor dierenartsen op het gebied van gedragsproblemen bij dieren in Nederland. De NWVG valt onder de Groep Geneeskunde van Gezelschapsdieren (GGG) van de Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij voor Diergeneeskunde (KNMvD).

company.name: Bombay Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, Mumbai, India

volunteer_experiences.description: Advising staff on veterinary and animal welfare matters.

Annually many dogs are seized by the authorities of European Member States and the UK, in line with the legislatory requirements of that country either because they have bitten a person or another animal and/or because they belong to a so-called “dangerous breed” or type.
Depending on the findings of the Courts/Authorities, these dogs may be:

    Enforced to be only let out on leash whilst muzzled.
    Enforced to undergo a behaviour-training course.
    Enforced to be contained whilst at home.
    Euthanised (killed/destroyed).

The ESVCE has concerns about how these dogs are “seized” (captured), managed whilst in custody, assessed and subsequently controlled and trained. In view of this, the ESVCE is conducting research into how “Dangerous Dogs” are managed and assessed and how this should ideally be carried out. To facilitate this, the ESVCE has set up a working group “Dogs of Law”.
This working group is composed of several active committee members and advisors.

Valerie Jonckheer-Sheehy (Chair)
Kendal Shepherd 
Noel Sweeney 

Current group goals are to:

    Create an inventory of the laws in relation to the capture, management whilst seized,   assessment, holding and identification of “Dogs of Law” in all EU countries and the United Kingdom (UK).
    To ascertain in which EU countries breed-specific legislation is in place, as that in the UK, and if so, upon which breeds is it imposed?

company.name: International Working Group Dogs of Law

volunteer_experiences.description: Writing protocols to correctly assess dogs that have been deemed "dangerous" and been taken into custody for assessment. These dogs are faced globally with an enormous animal welfare problem as they are sometimes seized, wrongfully accused, poorly managed whilst in custody and wrongfully condemned to euthanasia. Adequate guidelines on managing and assessing these dogs are lacking. Our group is working to help authorities improve guidelines on the management and assessment of these dogs to ensure public safety and animal welfare.
